titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3295) to establish a program to provide funds to States to replace punch card voting systems, to establish the Election Assistance Commission to assist in the administration of Federal elections and to otherwise provide assistance with the administration of certain Federal election laws and programs, to establish minimum election administration standards for States and units of local government with responsibility for the administration of Federal elections, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-331, by Mr. Reynolds.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3295 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. The amendment recommended by the Committee on House Administration now printed in the bill, modified by the amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution, shall be considered as adopted. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 107.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 311.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 193 (Roll no. 487).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/11/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3295 (voting process reform).
